intro: Dimeria sreenarayanae, commonly known as the Sreenarayana dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and upright growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
